text:
BB used to provide a link to authenticate when deploying. Now I'm seeing:
```ERROR: LoadError: Error found in GitHub reponse:
	Status Code: 401
	Message: Bad credentials
	Docs URL: <https://docs.github.com/rest>
	Errors:```

elements.text: BB used to provide a link to authenticate when deploying. Now I'm seeing:

ERROR: LoadError: Error found in GitHub reponse:
	Status Code: 401
	Message: Bad credentials
	Docs URL:

text: you mean with the wizard? what version of BB/julia?

elements.text: you mean with the wizard? what version of BB/julia?

text:
Yes I do:
```julia> BinaryBuilder.Wizard.github_auth(;allow_anonymous=false)
ERROR: Error found in GitHub reponse:
	Status Code: 401
	Message: Bad credentials
	Docs URL: <https://docs.github.com/rest>
	Errors:
Stacktrace:
  [1] error(::String, ::String, ::String, ::String, ::String)
    @ Base ./error.jl:42
  [2] handle_response_error(r::HTTP.Messages.Response)
    @ GitHub ~/.julia/packages/GitHub/Em3bH/src/utils/requests.jl:177
  [3] github_request(api::GitHub.GitHubWebAPI, request_method::Function, endpoint::String; auth::GitHub.OAuth2, handle_error::Bool, headers::Dict{Any, Any}, params::Dict{Any, Any}, allowredirects::Bool)
    @ GitHub ~/.julia/packages/GitHub/Em3bH/src/utils/requests.jl:68
  [4] #gh_get#4
    @ ~/.julia/packages/GitHub/Em3bH/src/utils/requests.jl:72 [inlined]
  [5] #authenticate#28
    @ ~/.julia/packages/GitHub/Em3bH/src/utils/auth.jl:56 [inlined]
  [6] authenticate
    @ ~/.julia/packages/GitHub/Em3bH/src/utils/auth.jl:55 [inlined]
  [7] #authenticate#29
    @ ./none:0 [inlined]
  [8] authenticate
    @ ./none:0 [inlined]
  [9] github_auth(; allow_anonymous::Bool)
    @ BinaryBuilder.Wizard ~/.julia/packages/BinaryBuilder/HOnlf/src/wizard/github.jl:11
 [10] top-level scope
    @ REPL[3]:1```
Using `master` for Julia and BB

text: I had this work this morning on v1.6. Weird.

elements.text: I had this work this morning on v1.6. Weird.

text: This also failed with 1.6.0-DEV.1625 (a178ac2cba). I'll update to the final release and report back

elements.text: This also failed with 1.6.0-DEV.1625 (a178ac2cba). I'll update to the final release and report back

text: Mystery solved. It was my fault. I had the `GITHUB_TOKEN` set in my startup.jl and I also rotated my PATs. I did check env to see if this was set but I forgot to check the startup.jl :face_palm:

elements.text: Mystery solved. It was my fault. I had the
set in my startup.jl and I also rotated my PATs. I did check env to see if this was set but I forgot to check the startup.jl

text: ok, thanks!  I don't think we can do anything to improve the error message, right?  the credentials were genuinely bad
